column4: hi all, I get the following error when trying to play a mp3 file with mpg123 [../../../src/audio.c:267] error: Unable to set up output device! Constraints: 44100, 22050 or 11025Hz.
anyone some idea where to look?
I somehow messed up sound in X, fixed that but now mpg123 is broken somehow
hi all, I get the following error when trying to play a mp3 file with mpg123 [../../../src/audio.c:267] error: Unable to set up output device! Constraints: 44100, 22050 or 11025Hz. anyone some idea?
use dmix as output device instead of hw?
i will try.. one mom
how do I do that?
is mpg123 actually using pulseaudio or some more direct device?
well, there're several packages providing mpg123... including mpg123-alsa, mpg123-esd and mpg123-nas. Think the base package is compiled against oss, which is rather obsolete...
mpg123-esd could be more pulseaudioish variant of it... but the -a is for selecting audiodevice
it has worked fine before. untill i installed libao-pulse, noticed it crewed up mpg123, then removed the package and after that mpg123 still doesn't work for me.
i try with -a swicth
still th esame
which audio device is it trying to use - oss, alsa, esd?
can't tell you ... : Unable to set up output device! Constraints: 44100, 22050 or 11025Hz.
seems it can't find any
mpg123 -a foo bar.mp3 # and then change the foo to somethin actually useful...
hmm... does "mpg123 -a dmix:0,0 foo.mp3" list only 48kHz s16 as available?
how about "mpg123 -a pulse foo.mp3"?
still the same
umm, add -q and read the *first* line of mpg123 output, that being the cause and not the end result :)
as in mpg123 -q -a pulse foo.mp3
compiling alsa right now...
it should differ for "-a pulse" and "-a dmix" and "-a hw"... compiling, why?
